page.title: 09SOCIAL CONCERNS continued
page.content: The only other convenience is a travelling library which comes around on the Wednesday of every third week at 2.10 p.m Several buses owned by a private firm travel each way from Yeovil to Marston every day and there is a late bus each Saturday. No petrol can be obtained in the village,the nearest station is either Mudford or Queen Camel. The main road through the village has no street lighting,no speed limit and two very sharp bends which make it quite dangerous. It is a noisy place because of the heavy road traffic passing through and as it is on the fligth path for Yeovilton Naval Air Base planes are constantly flying overhead. Most of the house are too expensive for young married people to buy.
